pattern_sequential_001.name: Sequential Flow
pattern_sequential_001.description: Linear sequence of activities where one task leads to another without branching
examples: The process starts with receiving a request, then processes it, and finally sends a response
First step is validation, then processing, then delivery
validation_rules: Each task must have exactly one incoming and one outgoing edge
Start and end events are required
anti_patterns: Tasks with multiple incoming/outgoing edges in sequential flow

pattern_parallel_001.name: Parallel Fork-Join
pattern_parallel_001.description: Multiple independent tasks execute in parallel, then rejoin at a synchronization point
examples: Process payment and send confirmation in parallel
Validate order, check inventory, and process payment at the same time
Email notification, SMS notification, and update database concurrently
validation_rules: Fork gateway must have 2+ outgoing edges
Join gateway must have 2+ incoming edges
All parallel branches must converge at join
No tasks between fork and join without proper connections
anti_patterns: Unbalanced forks (more branches out than in)
Tasks that only branch without rejoining

pattern_xor_001.name: Exclusive Choice (XOR)
pattern_xor_001.description: One of multiple mutually exclusive paths is taken based on a condition
examples: If order amount > 1000, require manager approval; otherwise, auto-approve
Route based on customer type: premium customers get fast track, standard get normal
Check payment method: credit card vs bank transfer vs cash
validation_rules: Each outgoing edge must have a guard condition
anti_patterns: Multiple paths executing simultaneously (use Inclusive for that)

pattern_or_001.name: Inclusive Choice (OR)
pattern_or_001.description: One or more paths can execute based on conditions
examples: Send email AND/OR SMS AND/OR push notification based on customer preferences
Optional processing: do core processing, then optionally add analytics, optionally send report
validation_rules: All active paths must complete before merge
At least one path must execute
anti_patterns: Using OR for mutually exclusive options (use XOR)

pattern_loop_001.name: Loop Pattern
pattern_loop_001.description: Tasks repeat based on a condition until the loop exit condition is met
examples: Keep retrying failed payment until success or max retries reached
Process each item in a batch one by one until all processed
Iterate through approval chain until all approvals obtained
validation_rules: Loop must have entry and exit condition
anti_patterns: Infinite loops without proper exit condition

pattern_event_001.name: Event-Driven Subprocess
pattern_event_001.description: Subprocess triggered by specific events with event handling
examples: Listen for payment confirmation event, trigger fulfillment
Monitor system health; if failure detected, execute emergency shutdown

pattern_exception_001.name: Exception Handler
pattern_exception_001.description: Task with error handling and recovery paths
examples: Try processing payment; if fails, retry with different payment method
Attempt connection; on error, log and continue
Execute critical task; if error, escalate to manager
validation_rules: Main task must have error event

pattern_subprocess_001.name: Subprocess
pattern_subprocess_001.description: Complex process encapsulated as a reusable subprocess
examples: Invoice approval subprocess contains multiple review steps
Order processing subprocess includes validation, payment, and fulfillment
validation_rules: Subprocess must have clear inputs and outputs

pattern_data_001.name: Data Object Flow
pattern_data_001.description: Tasks produce and consume data objects in a defined flow
examples: Order task produces order document, which is consumed by fulfillment task
Invoice creation produces invoice, which is used for payment processing
validation_rules: Data object must have producer and consumer
